intro: Adenostemma fastigiatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes. Adenostemma fastigiatum is also noted for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Malvaceae family.
